\section{Draft.js by Facebook}
\href{https://draftjs.org/}{Draft.js} is a framework for building rich text editors in React, powered
by an immutable model and abstracting over cross-browser differences.\par
\subsection{Core Concepts}
Draft.js provides a set of core building blocks:\par
\begin{itemize}
  \item \textbf{EditorState} - An immutable record representing the entire state of the editor

  \item \textit{ContentState} - The contents of the editor

  \item \texttt{SelectionState} - The current selection or cursor position
\end{itemize}
\subsection{Text Styling}
Draft.js supports inline styles like \textbf{bold}, \textit{italic}, \underline{underline}, and \texttt{code}.
You can also create custom inline styles for your application.\par
\subsubsection{Block Types}
Several block types are supported out of the box:\par
\begin{enumerate}
  \item Headers (h1 through h6)

  \item Blockquotes

  \item Code blocks

  \item Unordered and ordered lists
\end{enumerate}
\begin{quote}
  Draft.js is used in production by Facebook for comments, notes, and messenger.\par
\end{quote}
\subsection{Installation}
\begin{verbatim}npm install draft-js react react-dom\end{verbatim}Check out the
\href{https://draftjs.org/docs/getting-started}{docs} to get started.\par \par
